page.title: 13ANIMALS OF ASHDOWN FOREST
page.content: The largest animal on the Forest is the fallow deer sometimes seen at dusk or early in the morning. The fox and badger are both fairly common but the hedgehog keeps mainly to the edge of the forest as does the mole, there not being many earthworms in the acid forest soil. The dormouse is found in some hazel stands but is becoming rare. Shrews too are found, the common, pygmy amd water shrews, and the rabbit mainly in the more fertile valleys as the construction of warren tunnels in the forest soil is difficult. Mink now hunt many of the streams; smooth and crested newts can be found in the forest pools and grass snakes nearby. On the drier areas adders and the common lizard are to be seen in fairly large numbers.
